properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Periods of freezing rain are possible this evening and early Wednesday morning. Location: western Prince Edward Island Time span: late this evening and early Wednesday morning. Remarks: A mix of rain and freezing rain over western Prince Edward Island will end late this evening, followed by a second period of rain or freezing rain redeveloping overnight tonight. The precipitation will change to flurries Wednesday morning as brisk northwesterly winds bring in colder temperatures. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to PEstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #PEStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-11T17:23:21-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-11T01:24:21-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2254189757.2020
Area: Prince County P.E.I.
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Alberta Emergency Alert - Train Accident Alert Updated
properties.Summary:
Description: The State of Local Emergency and evacuation has been lifted for the community of Swalwell. Swalwell residents are asked to refer to the re-entry map, available on the Kneehill County website, prior to returning to their homes. The Reception Center located at the Prairie Bible Institute Cafeteria, 350 5th Ave North in Three Hills, will remain open for residents until 3:30 pm. ### Go to www.kneehillcounty.com for updates and more information, or call 403-443-5541.
Expires: 2020-03-17T15:02:08-06:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Kneehill County, 2020-03-10T15:00:18-06:00, NAADS-CA-AB-AEA1-6250
Area: Kneehill County
properties.Author: Kneehill County

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Elevated pollution levels are expected or occurring. DUST ADVISORY IN EFFECT FOR GOLDEN THE MINISTRY OF ENVIRONMENT (AMPERSAND)CLIMATE CHANGE STRATEGY IN COLLABORATION WITH THE INTERIOR HEALTH AUTHORITY HAS CONTINUED A DUST ADVISORY FOR GOLDEN DUE TO HIGH CONCENTRATIONS OF DUST THAT ARE EXPECTED TO PERSIST FOR THE NEXT 12 HOURS. EXPOSURE IS PARTICULARLY A CONCERN FOR PREGNANT WOMEN, INFANTS, THE ELDERLY AND THOSE WHO HAVE UNDERLYING MEDICAL CONDITIONS SUCH AS BREATHING OR LUNG CONDITIONS, HAY FEVER, ASTHMA OR PERSONS WHO REACT STRONGLY TO DUST. IF YOU ARE EXPERIENCING SYMPTOMS SUCH AS CONTINUING EYE OR THROAT IRRITATION, CHEST DISCOMFORT, SHORTNESS OF BREATH, COUGH OR WHEEZE, FOLLOW THE ADVICE OF YOUR HEALTH CARE PROVIDER. REAL-TIME AIR QUALITY OBSERVATIONS AND INFORMATION REGARDING THE HEALTH EFFECTS OF AIR POLLUTION CAN BE FOUND AT HTTPS://WWW2.GOV.BC.CA/GOV/CONTENT/ENVIRONMENT/AIR-LAND-WATER/AIR. FOR MORE INFORMATION ON CURRENT AIR QUALITY, VISIT WWW2.GOV.BC.CA/GOV/CONTENT/ENVIRONMENT/AIR-LAND-WATER/AIR. VISIT WWW.AIRHEALTH.CA FOR INFORMATION ON HOW TO REDUCE YOUR HEALTH RISK AND YOUR PERSONAL CONTRIBUTION TO POLLUTION LEVELS, AS WELL AS FOR CURRENT AND FORECAST AQHI VALUES. PLEASE CONTINUE TO MONITOR ALERTS AND FORECASTS ISSUED BY ENVIRONMENT CANADA. HTTP://WEATHER.GC.CA ### For more information on current air quality, visit www2.gov.bc.ca/gov/content/environment/air-land-water/air. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2020-03-12T03:51:12-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment, 2020-03-11T11:52:12-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3693498809.2020
Area: East Columbia
properties.Author: Environment Canada, the B.C. Ministry of Environment

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Snow and blowing snow expected Thursday and Thursday night. Total snowfall: 5 to 15 cm. Maximum wind gusts: 80 km/h. Locations: from Natuashish to Rigolet and vicinity. Time span: Thursday into Friday morning. Remarks: Snow, and strong northwesterly winds, are expected to develop in the Natuashish area Thursday morning and spread southward along the coast to Makkovik and Rigolet Thursday night. Fresh snowfall combined with strong winds will combine to reduce visibilities in blowing snow. A blowing snow advisory has been issued for Hopedale and vicinity. The public is advised to monitor future forecasts as warnings or advisories may be issued. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-12T05:40:19-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-11T13:41:19-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2642903877.2020
Area: Rigolet and vicinity, Postville - Makkovik, Nain and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, snow and strong winds to end the week. An intense low pressure system will affect the whole province on Friday and on Saturday. Regions in a line from the Temiscamingue region to the Eastern Townships and Beauce could see 15 to 25 millimetres of rain and strong winds. Further north and east, significant snowfall amounts are expected. Strong winds combined with this snow will greatly reduce visibilities in the blowing snow over some areas. For now, there is still some uncertainty as to the low pressure system's exact track. The types and amounts of precipitation will depend on this track. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-12T07:22:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-11T15:23:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3148761222.2020

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Potential significant snowfall expected tonight through Thursday night. Snow, heavy at times, is forecast to begin tonight. This snow is expected to ease in intensity Thursday morning or even transition to a few showers as temperatures warm to just above the freezing mark. By late Thursday afternoon, any liquid precipitation is expected to transition back to heavy snow once again. The heavy snow will then continue into Thursday night before coming to an end by Friday morning. Snowfall amounts tonight are expected to be in the 5 to 10 cm range with an additional 5 to 10 cm expected over Wawa - White River - Pukaskwa Thursday. If heavier snowfall amounts appear likely Thursday, Snowfall Warnings may be required. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2020-03-12T07:21:47-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-11T15:22:47-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.4236341583.2020
Area: Nipigon - Rossport, Marathon - Schreiber, White River - Dubreuilville, Wawa - Pukaskwa Park
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Blowing Snow Advisory In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Poor visibility in snow and blowing snow is expected or occurring in some locations. Total snowfall: 10 to 15 cm. Maximum wind gusts: 80 km/h. Locations: Hopedale and vicinity. Time span: Thursday morning until overnight Thursday night. Remarks: Fresh snowfall will combine with strengthening northwesterly winds on Thursday to produce poor visibility in blowing snow. The snow will taper off overnight Thursday night and winds will ease Friday morning. ### Travel is expected to be hazardous due to reduced visibility. Blowing snow advisories are issued when winds are expected to create blowing snow giving poor visibility to 800 metres or less for at least 3 hours. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to NLstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #NLwx.
Expires: 2020-03-12T05:40:39-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2020-03-11T13:41:39-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1279185282.2020
Area: Hopedale and vicinity
properties.Author: Environment Canada
